caption: This photograph features a dominating presence of a large metal electricity pylon standing on a sparse hillside. The pylon is constructed from steel beams arranged in a lattice structure, and it supports multiple high-voltage power lines that extend across the frame. The background shows a dramatic landscape with a curving river cutting through a valley surrounded by forested mountains. The river appears to be in a gorge, with its banks partially exposed, suggesting low water levels. The scene is set under a clear blue sky and the natural environment suggests a remote, wilderness area. The terrain surrounding the pylon is rugged and covered with dry grass and small bushes, indicating a possibly arid or seasonally dry climate. The photo seems to capture a juxtaposition of human industrial development within a natural landscape.
title: California--north fork of Kings River
